comments:
3.3 M1

1. start fresh workspce
2. create a simple project
3. add a simple text file
4. from the text editor open the properties dialog (Alt+Enter)
==> error is writtent to .log:

The class was not public. Fixed in HEAD >20060815.

Adding DJ to comment on this - should all classes that implement IAdapterFactory be public?

Well that pattern doesn't seem to be know and also not always causing the IAE: we have several implementors that are package visible and it seems that most of them  work. I guess it depends how/when the factory is invoked otherwise we would have seen more problems.
If being public is a must then we should write this into the Javadoc and give developers a heads-up on the list.

(In reply to comment #4)
> If being public is a must then we should write this into the Javadoc and give
> developers a heads-up on the list.

Yes. Is this requirement (classes being public) new in 3.3?
forgot to set the target milestone.
I believe that classes which are expected to be created via #createExecutableExtension have to have a public constructor. This shouldn't have changed. I will check.

OK - that's a different statement: of course, classes which are used in the plugin.xml (and hence create via createExecutableExtension) must be public. That was always the case. But if a factory is directly register with code it have any visibility.
*** Bug 154849 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Is this something that could be backported to 3.2.1 or 3.2.2?

(In reply to comment #11)
> Is this something that could be backported to 3.2.1 or 3.2.2?

If I can get a +1 from Dani and/or Tod, T I will release the fix to 3.2.1.  The fix was to make FileInputAdapterFactory public (it was created as a package-private class by the fix for bug 149643). Since this seems to be a regression introduced by a fix on the 3.2.1 stream, I would like to fix it in 3.2.1 too. Jim, thanks for making me look at this more closely.

Dani, Tod?
